column4: How can I downgrade to a lower version of notify-osd in Karmic?
you should be able to install a different major version alongside the minor one. otherwise, if it's still available, apt-get install <package>=<version>
do you know how I might find past versions? I'm trying notify-osd=0.9.9-0ubuntu1 and many variations thereof, using the same number, but still can't get it.
they'll be in previous release package repos
you're probably trying to do something broken though
hell 'n damnation is very family-friendly... according to the established church ;)
but yes, works for me too
is there a way I can install 0.9.11 from source and not have to remove the karmic version (thus getting rid of ubuntu-desktop, etc.)?
you /could/ put a different version in /usr/local, but it's probably more trouble than it's worth
I can't stand the fixed slot-allocation.
well, if it's for cosmetic reasons, go for it
how might I "go for it" without breaking ubuntu-desktop, etc.?
/usr/local is there for you to install whatever you like, so if you're happy to install from source, do so to there
/usr/local/bin is before /usr/bin in $PATH, so your custom version will be loaded by default
thanks, I'll give it a shot.
